content:
Action:2

I'm attempting to move left to gradually approach the exit door at (11,6) by clearing the dirt at (7,10) and proceeding toward our target.

Action:2

I'm moving the avatar left from (7,11) toward the exit path, as clearing dirt (if needed) and progressing left then downward will help approach the door while carefully managing obstacles.

Action:2

I'm moving left from my current position to start heading toward the exit door, expecting that clearing the dirt (and possibly using my sword if needed later) will open a pathway based on our strategic goal.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (7,9) toward the exit door at (11,6), expecting this move to bring me closer to my target and follow our strategy of approaching the door with caution.

Action:2

I'm moving left from (7,9) to head in the direction of the exit door, expecting to overcome the dirt obstacle and progress towards the target while keeping our diamond count in mind.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (7,9) to (7,10), which is a free background tile, to reposition safely and eventually head down toward the exit door while avoiding obstacles.

Action:4

I'm moving the avatar downwards to start carving a path toward the exit door at (11,6); I expect this move to position us closer to progressing to our goal.

Action:3

I'm moving right because it's the only adjacent open tile (background '.') that lets me change position and potentially reposition for a safer path toward the exit door.

Action:2

I'm moving left in order to start heading toward the exit door (which is down and left), expecting that once my avatar rotates and then moves, I can begin clearing the dirt (or dig through it) as needed to form a safe path.

Action:4

I'm choosing to move down since heading toward the exit will eventually require me to clear the dirt below to open a path, aligning with the strategy of moving carefully toward the door while managing obstacles.

Action:3

I’m moving right into the open background ('.') to explore further options, expecting this will eventually lead me to a path toward the exit or additional resources as suggested.

Action:2

I'll move left to start orienting toward the door, expecting that once the avatar faces left we can clear the adjacent dirt and step toward our exit path.

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar right into the free background space (row7, col10) to progress through the level, following our strategy of careful navigation and potential resource collection.

Action:4

I'm turning the avatar downward so that the next move or sword use can clear the dirt ahead to start heading toward the exit door.

Action:3

I'll move right from (7, col9) to the free background cell at (7, col10) to reposition and plan a safer route toward the exit door.

Action:2

I'm choosing to move left to head toward the exit door; even though the adjacent tile is dirt, I expect that if the avatar doesn't move immediately (due to rotation), another left action can clear or break it, aligning with our strategy of progressing safely downward and left.

Action:2

I'm moving left to start navigating toward the exit door, expecting to clear any dirt obstacles in the way and begin my controlled descent toward the door’s position.

Action:4

I'm directing the avatar downward to start progressing toward the exit door, expecting to break through the dirt below and get closer to the door at (11,6).

Action:3

I'm moving right into an open background cell (.) to start navigating towards the exit door while avoiding immediate obstacles, and I expect the avatar to shift from (7,8) to (7,9) as planned.

Action:2

I'm initiating a leftward move to orient toward the exit door (which is down‐left from our current position) and to eventually clear the dirt obstacle at (7,7) that blocks our path. I expect that after this rotation, a subsequent leftward move or use–sword action will actually clear the dirt and move us closer to our goal.

Action:2

I'm moving left from (7,8) toward the exit door area in hopes of clearing the dirt and progressing downward; this aligns with the strategy of approaching the door under the safe diamond count.

Action:4

I’m moving down from (7,8) toward the level’s lower areas where the exit door is located, expecting to clear some dirt and gradually advance toward our objective.

Action:3

I am moving right because the tile immediately to the right (row7, col9) is clear (represented by '.') and allows safe progression while avoiding the nearby boulder at left.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (7,8) to (7,9) since that cell is free, expecting to advance toward a safer path and set up a descent toward the exit door.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (7,9) to (8,9) to begin heading toward the exit door at (11,6) while carefully avoiding the boulder on my left; I expect this move to bring me closer to forming a safe path.

Action:2

I'm moving left to start aligning my position with the exit door at (11,6), expecting that this will gradually head me in the correct direction.

Action:4

I'm moving down from row7, col9 to approach the exit door eventually, expecting this to open a path through the dirt toward our lower-level goal while keeping hazards in mind.

Action:2

I'm moving the avatar left from (7, col9) towards a clearer path while planning to head downward later, aligning with the strategy of careful navigation away from hazards.

Action:2

I move left to start heading toward the exit door area, expecting that this clear tile will allow smoother navigation and help me plan a route for gathering the necessary resources.

Action:4

I'm moving downward toward the exit door (row11, col6) by targeting the dirt tile below at row8, col8, expecting that this will either clear or allow passage toward our overall objective.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (7,8) to head toward lower rows so I can eventually approach the exit door safely, while avoiding the nearby boulder on the left.

Action:2

I'm moving left from (8,8) to begin progressing toward the exit door area while clearing dirt, expecting this change in position will help head toward the door at (11,6) as planned.

Action:2

I’m moving left into the dirt at (8,7) to start heading toward the exit door at (11,6), expecting this brings me closer to my goal while clearing a path.

Action:2

I'm moving the avatar left from (8,8) to (8,7) as part of the path toward the exit door at (11,6), expecting this move to bring me closer to the goal safely.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (8,8) to begin heading toward the exit door while avoiding the boulder on the left, expecting this movement will clear a path through the dirt and bring me closer to my goal.

Action:4

I'm moving downward into the dirt at (9,8) to progress toward the exit door at (11,6), expecting that the dirt tile will be cleared as I advance in the level.

Action:2

I'm moving the avatar left from (9,8) to (9,7) in order to collect the diamond there and start heading toward the exit at (11,6); I expect that gathering one diamond (well under the limit) and approaching the door aligns with our strategy.

Action:2
I'm moving left to grab the diamond at row9, col7, which aligns with our plan to collect resources safely before heading to the exit.

Action:4

I’ll attempt to move downward toward the exit door, expecting that if the first ACTION_DOWN only rotates the avatar, a second down move will actually clear the dirt in row10, col7 and help pave the way toward the door.
